ราคา BNB ติดที่ต่ำสุด 7 เดือน - 1 ล้านที่อยู่ใหม่จะจุดประกายการฟื้นตัวหรือไม่

BNB Price Hits 7-Month Low—Will 1 Million New Addresses Spark a Rebound?

1d ago//Aaryamann Shrivastava
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

ราคา BNB ได้ดิ่งลดลงสู่ระดับต่ำสุดในรอบ 7 เดือน โดยร่วงลงจาก 900 เหรียญสหรัฐมาอยู่ใกล้ 700 เหรียญสหรัฐ แสดงการปรับตัวลงลึกถึง 22.5% ในช่วงสัปดาห์ที่ผ่านมา อย่างไรก็ตาม แม้จะมีแรงขายหนัก แต่กิจกรรมของเครือข่ายกลับขยายตัวอย่างมาก โดยมีการเพิ่มที่อยู่เครือข่ายใหม่ (New Addresses) มากกว่า 1 ล้านรายการต่อวัน ซึ่งบ่งชี้ว่ามีดอกเบี้ยใหม่และเงินทุนสดใหม่เข้ามาในระบบ และอาจช่วยดูดซับแรงกดดันจากการขายได้ ทั้งนี้ ข้อมูลจากตลาด Derivatives ยังคงบ่งชี้ความเสี่ยงที่มีต่อราคาในแนวลง เนื่องจากนักเทรดมีท่าทีเป็นข้างเสียอย่างชัดเจนในตลาด Futures ระดับแนวรับสำคัญที่ต้องจับตามองอยู่ที่ 682 เหรียญสหรัฐ หากราคาตกผ่านจุดนี้อาจทำให้เกิดการ Liquidation ในฝั่ง Long และกดดันให้ราคาลดลงไปที่ 650 เหรียญสหรัฐ ในขณะที่การฟื้นตัวจำเป็นต้องยึดเหนี่ยวระดับ 735 และ 768 เหรียญสหรัฐก่อนจะกลับมามีแนวโน้มขาขึ้นได้อีกครั้ง

EN

BNB has plummeted to a seven-month low, dropping from $900 to near $700, marking a 22.5% decline over the past week. Despite this bearish price action, the network is experiencing a surge in adoption, consistently adding over 1 million new addresses daily. This influx of new holders suggests sustained interest and fresh capital entering the ecosystem, which could potentially help absorb selling pressure and stabilize the asset. However, derivatives data indicates that downside risks remain elevated due to strong bearish positioning in the futures market. With significantly higher short leverage compared to longs, the critical support level to watch is $682. A break below this threshold could trigger further long liquidations and push the price toward $650, while a recovery would require reclaiming $735 and eventually $768 to invalidate the bearish thesis.

Key Points

  • BNB price dropped 22.5% in a week, hitting a 7-month low near $700.
  • Network activity remains strong with over 1 million new addresses created daily.
  • Futures market is bearish, with significant downside leverage centered on the $682 support level.
  • A breach of $682 could trigger further declines toward $650, while reclaiming $768 is needed for a bullish reversal.

Article

BNB falls to 7 month low after drop from $900 to $700. Network adds over 1 million new addresses despite price weakness. Bearish futures positioning keeps downside risk elevated near $682. BNB has experienced a sharp correction, with the price falling from $900 to near $700 in recent sessions. The decline erased months of gains and pushed the asset to a seven-month low. While selling pressure has dominated, the downturn may not be finished unless holder behavior shifts. Emerging on-chain trends suggest conditions could still change. BNB Is Observing A Flood Of New Holders BNB’s network activity has shown notable strength despite the price crash. New address creation has risen consistently over recent days, peaking near 1.3 million additions. Even now, the network continues to add more than 1 million new addresses daily. This growth signals sustained interest during a volatile period. Sponsored Sponsored New addresses are significant because they often represent fresh capital entering the ecosystem. While existing holders are facing selling pressure, new participants can help absorb supply. Historically, strong network growth during corrections has supported stabilization. For BNB, this influx may counterbalance distribution if buying interest persists. Want more token insights like this? Sign up for Editor Harsh Notariya’s Daily Crypto Newsletter here . BNB New Addresses. Source: Glassnode Despite improving on-chain participation, derivatives data remains bearish. Futures market positioning shows a clear skew toward downside risk. Liquidation maps highlight approximately $43 million in short liquidation leverage compared with just $6 million on the long side. This imbalance reflects strong bearish conviction among leveraged traders. Such positioning often amplifies volatility. If price continues to decline, long liquidations could accelerate losses. The map shows the largest cluster of long contracts sitting at $682, BNB’s next support . Losing this support would also trigger $3.07 million in long liquidations. For now, the dominance of bearish exposure suggests caution. BNB Liquidation Map. Source: Coinglass BNB Price Correction Could Continue BNB price has declined 22.5% over the past seven days and is trading near $698 at the time of writing. Technical indicators point to continued weakness. The Fibonacci Extension tool identifies $682 as the next major support level, making it a critical zone for near-term price stability. If broader market conditions remain bearish, downside risks increase. Continued liquidations or heightened volatility could push BNB below $682. A breakdown there would likely send the price toward $650 or lower. Such a move would deepen losses and reinforce bearish sentiment among short-term investors. BNB Price Analysis. Source: TradingView A recovery scenario depends on capital inflows offsetting bearish pressure. If demand strengthens, BNB could reclaim $735 and advance toward $768. Flipping the latter into support would invalidate the bearish thesis. Under that outcome, BNB price may recover toward $821, signaling renewed confidence.
